author: poojaranjan
content:
Congratulations on the merge of the first RIP in the RIPS folder.

https://github.com/ethereum/RIPs/blob/master/RIPS/rip-7212.md

author: poojaranjan
content: I was hoping to get some understanding of the standardization process for Rollup proposals with the merge of the first proposal if the group intend to have it differently, but they are still open for me.

author: poojaranjan
content: Like does the Roll up community want to place Roll up proposal under “Standard Track” like shared in the diagram below or it is placed somewhere else?

author: poojaranjan
content: According to EIP-1, “**Standard Track-Core**”  proposals are proposals for upgrading Ethereum Mainnet (Execution or Consensus Layer). Then should we have “Standard Track-Core” in RIPS folder if there is no intent of it being deployed on the Ethereum Mainnet?

author: poojaranjan
content: I could have understood if Rollup Standards were out of Ethereum repository but IMO, under the same repo, one standard means differently at different folders can be confusing.

author: poojaranjan
content: This is not a hill, I’d like to die on but sincerely appreciate some documentation to be shared with the community.

author: abcoathup
content: Its a precompile, so standards track-core feels ok as a RIP.  Especially as there is potential to make this an EIP in future too.
